NSDate * lastExternalized
 Returns the NSDate that is returned by sending -lastTouched to the receiver's extore immediately after an externalization, or the time of the last externalization, whichever is later. Note that these times may differ by a few milliseconds. The second comparand is to support extores that do not keep track of their 'last touched' time and return NSDistantPast.
NSDate * lastInternalized
 Returns the last NSDate that we completed internalizing the receiver's extore.

Detailed Description

A class which knows static information about an OwnerApp and its exformat.

GLOSSARY Browser: An installed browser application such as Safari, Camino, etc. Service: Google Bookmarks, del.icio.us, etc. OwnerApp: A Browser (installed application) or a Service (web application) Exformat: The format and structure of the bookmarks in an OwnerApp Browfile: structure of a profile or account supported by a particular ownerApp, or a builtout browfile. Examples: > structure of a particular Firefox profile > structure of a particular Google Bookmarks account > structure of a particular standalone bookmarks file

Member Function Documentation

- (Extore*) extore  

Returns the extore owned by the receiver, creating one if needed, with a default BkmmDeference of BkmmDeferenceAsk.

A newly-created Browfile instance does not have an extore. A transient Browfile instance created for a simple purpose may never require one. However, once one is created, it is stored as an ivar.

Returns:
An extore whose class is the subclass of Extore given by -extoreClass

- (Extore *) extoreWithDeference: (BkmmDeference)  deference  

Returns the extore owned by the receiver, creating one if needed, with a specified BkmmDeference.

A newly-created Browfile instance does not have an extore. A transient Browfile instance created for a simple purpose may never require one. However, once one is created, it is stored as an ivar.

Parameters:
deference The value of the ivar 'deference' to set in the receiver.
Returns:
An extore whose class is the subclass of Extore given by -extoreClass

Returns a dictionary containing a key/value pair for each non-nil part of the receiver's identity.

Parameters:
identifier The identifier to be decoded.
Returns:
A dictionary containing constKeyIdentifierXXXX key/value pair(s)
Gets the -intValue of the receiver's extoreMedia attribute

Returns an identifier which uniquely describes the receiver.

See BrowfileIdentifierCodecs class overview for precise specification. 

Encodes the two otherMacXXXXX values from a given a dictionary into a full filesystem path to a Home directory in the /Volumes directory.

See +[BrowfileIdentifierCodecs homePathWithParts] for precise specification.

Returns the Extore subclass, an instance of which is or could become the receiver's extore.

Property Documentation

- (NSString*) exformat [read, write, retain]

The external format of the receiver.

This is required for all browfiles.

- (NSNumber*) extoreMedia [read, write, assign]

The external storage media of the receiver.

One of the BkmmExtoreXXXXX constants.

- (NSString*) otherMacAccount [read, write, retain]

The Macintosh account name of the receiver.

Browfiles of extoreMedia BkmmExtoreOtherHome must have this attribute. Other extoreMedia types must not have this attribute.

- (NSString*) otherMacVolume [read, write, retain]

The Macintosh Volume name, in the file system, of the receiver.

Browfiles of extoreMedia BkmmExtoreOtherHome may have this attribute. Other extoreMedia types must not have this attribute.

- (NSString*) profileName [read, write, retain]

The profile name or account name of the receiver.

Of the desktopApp extores, only Firefox have one of these.  All webApp extores have one of these.

- (NSString*) standalonePath [read, write, retain]

The file system path to the external store, of the receiver.

Browfiles of extoreMedia BkmmExtoreStandalone must have this attribute. Other extoreMedia types must not have this attribute.
